did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: Willie Lee Atkyns, Jr. was born 13 September 1913 in Washington, D.C. Atkyns is a painter, teacher and printmaker.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Willie Lee Atkyns, Jr. was born 13 September 1913 in Washington, D.C. Atkyns is a painter, teacher and printmaker. A member of the Landscape Club of the Washington Arts Club and other associations, Atkyns was the director of the Lee Atkyns Studio School of Art (Washington, D.C.) from 1950-1975. He relocated to Duncansville, PA in 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains Atkyns' scrapbooks [5], including photographs of his paintings and exhibitions, newspaper clippings, exhibition brochures and programs and professional correspondence. The scrapbooks contain frequent annotations by Atkyns concerning his career, the images, clippings or notices found in the books. Atkyns paintings can be found in the permanent collection of the William Benton Museum of Art at the University of Connecticut.

relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to literature. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
